result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant will have no further contacts with law enforcement during the term of this agreement that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to alleged criminal conduct on the part of the Defendant. 2. The Defendant shall notify The Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment. 3. The Defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $2,500. A surcharge of 10% will be added to the amount of $2,500 if the agreement is not successfully completed. Additionally, a 5% surcharge will be added to all costs, fines, and restitution assessed. Restitution shall be paid within the first 12 (twelve) of the agreement to the Pepin County District Attorney Trust Account at P.O. Box 206, Durand, WJ 54736. 4. One (1) month prior to the completion of this contract, the Defendant must contact the Pepin County District Attorney's Office by telephone or in person for a final interview to discuss compliance with this contract. 5. The Defendant must report in person as requested to the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him. 6. The Defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable. If you violate the terms of this contract the Pepin County District Attorney may at any time during or subsequent to the term of this agreement, (1) revoke, modify, add or delete conditions to this Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea or No Contest Agreement; (2) change the period of deferment; (3) move the Court for acceptance of your guilty or no contest plea.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid in installments of $10.00 per month commencing 08-15-2022 and the first of each month for one year then $100.00 per month thereafter until paid in full.  Payment to be first applied to County Appointed Attorney Fees TBD.
AMENDED 09-02-2022 - County Appointed Attorney Fees ordered in the amount of $790.00.

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 80 hours of community service.  Identify the project within 30 days. Complete all hours within one year with minimum of 8 hours per month.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina M. Blodgett

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Attorney
Proposed Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement

8:58 AM   Defendant Christina M. Blodgett in court.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney S. Joseph Randtke appeared by video for Christina M. Blodgett. State made an offer of DAGPA and also filing of misdemeanor theft charge but unsure if Ms. Blodgett is in agreement.  Atty Randtke submitted PLQ in accordinance with that and attached Deferred Acceptance.  State can file an Amended Information after that.  State complied with victim rights and there is a term in the DAGPA.  Court advises of right to PH.  Court finds Ms. Blodgett KVI waives right to PH and on advise of counsel.  Court reviews charges/max. penalties of count 1.  In addition to that an oral amendment to criminal complaint will be made to the complaint of misd. theft/max. penalties.  Mr. Seifert to file an Information to include a misdemeanor complaint.  Court reviews DAGP agreement for 3 years with defendant and restitution payments.  There will be a 10% + 5% restitution surcharge if unsuccessful. If not convicted, you would not have to pay those surcharges.   If you violate the agreement, the DA can request the agreement be revoked and then we would go into sentencing.  Court reviews constitutional rights with defendant.  Court finds defendant KVI waives constitutional rights.  The the charge in count 1, defendant pleads guilty.  Court defers acceptance and approve DAGPA.  To misd. theft defendant pleads guilty, court accepts plea and finds her guilty.  State made an offer of court costs $443 and 80 hours community service or court costs $443 and 10 days jail.  Ms. Blodgett wishes to do the 80 hours community service.  Complete 80 hours of community service and complete within the first year of the agreement.  8 hours/mo. until completed and within 30 days identify your project to the Judge's office.  It has to be community organization, non-profit.  Court costs $443.00 and county appointed attorney fees. The first $2500 to be paid to the DA for restitution.  Atty Randtke proposes $10/mo. for the first 12 months until paid off restitution.  Court so orders.  Funds on deposit be applied to attorney fees first and the $10/mo. to be paid to the COC be applied to attorney fees then apply to court costs.  Ms. Blodgett to start making payments to the DA by 9/1 of $250/mo. Appeal rights given.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:54 PM Defendant Christina M. Blodgett in court with Attorney S. Joseph Randtke by zoom technology by video means.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Ms. Blodgett previously appeared and was informed of charges.  Ms. Blodgett has no questions.  Mr. Randtke WTL for PH and close to a resolution and ask for a plea hearing 45-60 days out.  If counsel appears by zoom, it would save the defendant roughly $300 which could be paid for restitution.  Ms. Blodgett agrees.  Mr. Randtke may appear by zoom and Ms. Blodgett in person or zoom if she wishes.  Defendant confirms her address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 01:44 PM Defendant Christina M. Blodgett in court with Attorney S. Joseph Randtke by zoom technology by video means for Defendant Christina M. Blodgett. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties and rights.  Court verifies payment of attorney fees.  Ms. Blodgett requests to pay $50/mo com. on 5th and 19th.  Court so agrees.  Ms. Blodgett you need to report to the Sheriff's Department today for fingerprints.  Mr. Randtke waives the time limits for PH.  Court finds Ms. Blodgett waives time limits for PH but not the PH itself.  Once you have made contact with Ms. Blodgett, she needs to be in person but counsel allowed to appear by zoom.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Ordered that Attorney Randtke is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $100.00 per month commencing 5/1/2022, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.  See Order
State Public Defender Eligibility Evaluation Form - Not eligible.
